alert.note: Alert for Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 3:14PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Siskiyou, northwestern Modoc and south central Klamath Counties through 345 PM PDT... At 313 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Merrill, or 18 miles southeast of Klamath Falls, moving northwest at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Klamath Falls, Tulelake, Merrill, Miller Island Klamath Wildlife Area, Midland, Lower Klamath Wildlife Refuge, Moore Park, Olene, and Altamont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties
